wrongFullText:
NEWSWilliamson County, TNAdd TopicJuvenile accused of making threat targeting Centennial and Independence high schools Andy HumblesThe TennesseanUpdated April 9, 2018, 11:48 a.m. ETA juvenile is in custody for a threat posted on social media targeting Centennial and Independence high schools in Williamson County.

The juvenile was taken into custody overnight, said Williamson County Sheriff's Office spokeswoman Sharon Puckett said.

Police believe there is no known threat at either Centennial or Independence high schools, Puckett said.

Normal school activities are taking place Monday at both schools, Williamson County Schools spokeswoman Carol Birdsong said.

"We want to remind parents and students that any student making a threat will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law," Birdsong said in an email. "In addition, that student will face school discipline. We have the full support of law enforcement and the juvenile court system."

Birdsong requested that families should report issues of concern to law enforcement or school administrators.

There was also a previous threat investigated Sunday night in reference to Clovis High School in New Mexico that raised concerns locally because that school had the same initials as Centennial High School, Puckett said.

A separate threat referenced Centennial and Independence and resulted in the juvenile arrest, Puckett said.

Reach Andy Humbles at ahumbles@tennessean.com or 615-726-5939 and on Twitter @ AndyHumbles.
